Legal_Issue: Whether NTD Apparel Inc. can demonstrate special circumstances excusing non-use of the KOALA BLUE trademark
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence of special circumstances or concrete steps towards resuming use
Burden_of_Proof: On trademark owner (NTD Apparel Inc.) to show use or special circumstances
Credibility_Factor: Lack of credible evidence regarding obstacles beyond control or intent to resume use
Legal_Rule: Section 45(3) of the Trade-marks Act allows for expungement unless special circumstances excuse non-use
Standard_of_Review: Statutory appeal standard under section 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Issue: Proper procedure for responding to Registrar's notice and presenting additional evidence on appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-use of trademark for three consecutive years without justification
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Opportunity to present evidence was provided; process followed correctly
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of sales, marketing, or commercial activity using KOALA BLUE; absence of documented plans to resume use
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law, specifically sections 45 and 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Applicant_Challenge: NTD Apparel Inc. challenging expungement of trademark registration
Defendant_Response: Insufficient explanation or evidence provided by NTD Apparel Inc.
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of use or non-use, statements regarding business intentions
Remedy_Sought: Set aside Registrar's decision to expunge
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use for three years without special circumstances
Applicable_Process: Ex parte review by Registrar followed by statutory appeal
